titleStmt.title: The Earle of Darby's speech on the scaffold, immediately before his execution at Bolton in Lancashire, on Wednesday, October 15. 1651. Exactly taken in short-hand, as it was spoken; and now published for the satisfaction of those that desire to be truly informed.
titleStmt.author: Derby, James Stanley, Earl of, 1607-1651.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Nathaniel Brooks, and are to be sold at his shop at the sign of the Angel in Cornhil,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
